results.title: The Decision to drop the bomb
results.creator_credit: National Broadcasting Company and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The Manhattan Project, the making of the first atomic bomb. History of the making of this weapon, the political background, the war situation in 1945 and the final testing in New Mexica. Also includes the meeting at Potsdam where Churchill, Stalin and Truman discussed the European situation and the war with Japan. Truman advised Stalin that a secret weapon of some magnitude had been made. The decision to drop the bomb on Hiroshima was carried out while Truman was returning to the United States. Reporter: Chet Huntley.

results.title: The Decision makers
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Looks at the problem of small group decision-making. An inadequately briefed syndicate group wastes time deciding what it is supposed to be discussing. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Decision
results.brief_description: An experimental film using a mixture of animation and live action which contrasts the fantasy and romantic ideals of the traditional fairy tale with the life of an ordinary woman confined to her home.

results.title: The Decision
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Larry Gosnel and Julian Biggs
results.brief_description: The conflict arises in the Canadian rural scene where the pressures of rising prices, competitive markets, higher production costs, force farmers to abandon their traditional views of farming as a way of life, for one that places it on high levels of business. Shows how a father, holding on to old ways, and son holding onto new, resolve differences in such a way as to enable them to keep abreast of advancement in agriculture. Based on the short story by Charles Israel.

results.title: The Decameron
results.creator_credit: Produzioni Europee Associati, Alberto Grimaldi, Franco Rossellini and Pier Pasolini
results.brief_description: The first installment of Pasolini’s lively ‘Trilogy of Life’, drawn from famous story cycles (‘The Canterbury Tales’ and ‘The Arabian Nights’ followed). Based on eight of Boccaccio’s tales of sexual deception set mostly around 14th-century Naples, including those of the seducing nuns, the three jealous brothers who murder their sister’s lover, the wizard who could turn his wife into a burro, and the story of a false saint. Pasolini plays Giotto, the fresco painter around whom the various tales revolve. The film won the Special Jury Prize at Berlin in 1971. Cast includes Patrizia Capparelli, Franco Citti, Ninetto Davoli, Angela Luce and Sylvana Magano. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Debate continues...
results.brief_description: Tells the history of the House of Commons, shows how it carried on after the Chamber was bombed in 1941 and illustrates the construction and opening of the new Chamber by H.M. the King George VI. Contains archival footage.

results.title: The Death penalty?
results.brief_description: In Britain death is the penalty for only a few specified crimes, but there is still a great deal of controversy about capital punishment. Here the evidence for and against is discussed by the Public Hangman, prominent churchmen, chiefs of police and murderers themselves. Relatives of victims also express their views.

results.title: The Death of trees: Eucalyptus dieback
results.brief_description: All over Australia trees are dying for reasons not fully understood. Scientists have termed this phenomenon “dieback”. Within Australia a microscopic fungi and certain insects have been isolated as the cause of the massive destruction of jarrah, New England and eucalypt forests. Scientists are now looking at cloning techniques as a method of breeding trees that are genetically resistant to dieback.

results.title: The Death of stars
results.creator_credit: Coastal Community Colleges and David P. Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
This program examines the death of a star, in particular focusing on the death of our own star, the sun. Once the sun becomes a Red Giant, i.e. when the core compresses but the outer layer expands, the Earth will become uninhabitable. As a Red Giant, the sun will expand into the solar system, swallowing up the inner circle of planets. A star ends its life as a planetary nebulae and evolves into a White Dwarf. Some stars explode, particularly binary stars which results in the creation of supernovae.

results.title: The Death of Socrates
results.creator_credit: Columbia Broadcasting System, Charles W. Russell and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: A reconstruction of 399BC in Athens where Socrates, judged guilty of the corruption of youth and of refusal to recognize accepted gods of state faces execution according to Athenian law by drinking poison. Those who had been his main accusers said they did not desire his death but Anytus the politician who caused the trial refuses to reverse his judgement. In prison where a small group of friends have gathered Socrates speaks of the values he has cherished. Without being able to discourse daily about virtue and the greatest good of man he has no reason to live. He drinks poison and as friends weep, dies. Narrated by Walter Cronkite. Cast includes John Cassavetes as Plato, Robert Culp as Xenophon, E.G. Marshall as Aristophanes, Shepperd Strudwic as Crito, Milton Selzer as Melitus and Richard Kiley, Michael Higgins, Barry Jones, Philip Bourneuf, Grant Gordon and Victor Thorley.
